title: Uncertainty Propagation Rules
description: Programmatic rules for propagating measurement uncertainties. Pick a rule family based on the complexity and accuracy required: 'simplest' (uniform interval, conservative), 'better' (RSS for independent random errors), 'even_better' (single-variable calculus), 'pro' (multivariable with partial derivatives), and 'repeated_measurements' (statistics for mean & spread). Apply rules recursively on an expression tree; combine absolute uncertainties for sums/differences and fractional uncertainties for products/quotients as specified by the chosen family. For functions not covered, use the upper–lower–bound method.

source.citation: Champlain College Physics SN2, Chapter 3: Propagating Uncertainties

simplest.model: Uniform probability inside the ±interval (100% inside, 0% outside). Accepted in this class; overestimates uncertainty.

sum_or_difference.name: Add absolute uncertainties
sum_or_difference.equation_text: If q = x + y − z − w then δq = δx + δy + δz + δw

product_or_quotient.name: Add fractional uncertainties
product_or_quotient.equation_text: If q = (x·y)/(z·w) then δq/|q| = δx/|x| + δy/|y| + δz/|z| + δw/|w|

times_exact_constant.name: Multiplication by an exact number
times_exact_constant.equation_text: If q = Bx with exact B, then δq = |B| δx (fractional uncertainty unchanged)

power_function.name: Power rule (numeric exponent)
power_function.equation_text: If q = x^n then δq/|q| = |n| · δx/|x| (includes n=1/2 for square root)

other_functions_upper_lower.name: Upper–lower–bound method
other_functions_upper_lower.equation_text: δq = |q_max − q_min| / 2, with q_max = f(x+δx, …), q_min = f(x−δx, …)

better.model: Independent random errors combined in quadrature (RSS). More realistic than 'simplest'.

sum_or_difference.name: RSS for sums/differences
sum_or_difference.equation_text: If q = x + y − z − w then δq = sqrt( (δx)^2 + (δy)^2 + (δz)^2 + (δw)^2 )

better.interpretation_notes: Uncertainty represents the standard deviation; ~34% probability lies outside ±1σ; <5% outside ±2σ.

even_better.model: Single-variable differential (calculus) approximation for non-linear functions.

single_variable_function.name: Differential method (one variable)
single_variable_function.equation_text: δq = |dq/dx| · δx (e.g., q=cos x ⇒ δq = |sin x| δx with δx in radians)

pro.model: Multivariable differential method with partial derivatives and RSS.

repeated_measurements.model: Statistical aggregation for repeated measurements: mean, standard deviation, standard deviation of the mean.
repeated_measurements.interpretation_notes: S describes spread of single measurements; S_m describes uncertainty on the mean; S_m ∝ 1/√n.
